TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit OracleBinary extends System.ValueType implements class System.Data.SqlTypes.INullable, class System.IComparable
Public Structure OracleBinary Implements IComparable, INullable
public value class OracleBinary : IComparable, System::Data::SqlTypes::INullable

Docs.summary: Represents a variable-length stream of binary data to be stored in or retrieved from a database.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To obtain an <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary> object, call the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleDataReader.GetOracleBinary%2A> method.

Docs.param: The object to be compared to this structure.
Docs.summary: Compares this object to the supplied object and returns an indication of their relative values.
Docs.returns:
A signed number indicating the relative values of this structure and the object.
Return Value
Condition
Less than zero
The value of this object is less than the object.
Zero
This object is the same as the object.
Greater than zero
This object is greater than the object.
-or-
The object is a null reference.

## Remarks [Visual Basic]
In Visual Basic, you can use the conversions defined by the class, but you cannot override them or create your own. If Option Strict is set, you must use the \<CType operator> to convert the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary> to a binary object.
The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.Value?displayProperty=nameWithType>
